00022 #include <common/Disposable.h>
00023 
00024 /// \brief
00025 /// GisDictionaryElement is an element in a GisDictionary. It consists of a
00026 /// name-value pair.
00027 class GisDictionaryElement : public GisDisposable
00028 {
00029 
00030 public:
00031 
00032     /// \brief
00033     /// Constructs and initializes a a GisDictionaryElement
00034     /// 
00035     /// \param name 
00036     /// Input the name of the element (required)
00037     /// \param name 
00038     /// Input the value of the element. Can be blank (L"")
00039     /// 
00040     /// \return
00041     /// Returns GisDictionaryElement
00042     /// 
00043     GIS_API static GisDictionaryElement* Create(GisString* name, GisString* value);
00044 
00045     /// \brief
00046     /// Gets the name of this element
00047     /// 
00048     /// \return
00049     /// Returns the element name
00050     /// 
00051     GIS_API virtual GisString* GetName();
00052 
00053     /// \brief
00054     /// Indicates that this object does not allow its name
00055     /// to change. Not allowing name change allows more efficient 
00056     /// random access to GisDictionary.
00057     /// 
00058     /// \return
00059     /// Returns false
00060     /// 
00061     GIS_API virtual GisBoolean CanSetName()
00062     {
00063         return false;
00064     }
00065 
00066     /// \brief
00067     /// Gets the value of this dictionary element.
00068     /// 
00069     /// \return
00070     /// Returns the element value
00071     /// 
00072     GIS_API virtual GisString* GetValue();
00073 
00074     /// \brief
00075     /// Sets the value of this dictionary element
00076     /// 
00077     /// \param value 
00078     /// Input the element value
00079     /// 
00080     GIS_API virtual void SetValue(GisString* value);
00081 
00082 protected:
00083 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00084     /// Constructs a default instance of a GisDictionaryElement.
00085     GIS_API GisDictionaryElement()
00086     {
00087     }
00088 
00089     /// Constructs an instance of a GisDictionaryElement using the specified arguments.
00090     GIS_API GisDictionaryElement(GisString* name, GisString* value);
00091 
00092     GIS_API virtual ~GisDictionaryElement() {}
00093 /// \endcond
00094 
00095 private:
00096 
00097     /// The name of the dictionary element. 
00098     GisStringP                        mName;
00099 
00100     /// The element value
00101     GisStringP                        mValue;
00102 };
00103 
00104 /// \brief
00105 /// GisDictionaryElementP is a GisPtr on GisDictionaryElement, provided for convenience.
00106 typedef GisPtr<GisDictionaryElement> GisDictionaryElementP;
00107 
00108 #endif
